alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 12:41AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Henry, eastern Van Buren, western Lee and northeastern Clark Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1241 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bentonsport/Vernon, or near Keosauqua, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bentonsport/Vernon around 1245 AM CDT. Bonaparte around 1250 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Donnellson, Croton, Franklin and New Boston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
